data.title: Progressive Geographies
data.meta_description: Posts about Alexandre Kojève written by stuartelden
data.text:
Marco Filoni and Massimo Palma (eds.), Tyrants at Work: Philosophy and Politics in Alexandre Kojève – Editions ETS, 2024 (print and open access) This volume wants to restore the depth and contradictions – both theoretical and biographical, political and speculative – of … Continue reading →

A collection of essays on Emile Benveniste; Matthew Specter, Habermas: An Intellectual Biography; Nicolai Trubetzkoy, The Legacy of Genghis Khan and Other Essays on Russia’s Identity; Marcelo Hoffman’s Foucault in Brazil: Dictatorship, Resistance, and Solidarity; Leo Strauss, On Tyranny, which … Continue reading →

In the last update on this project, I talked about the Paris archival work I’d done in early February. There were a few loose ends of references when I got back from Paris, most of which I was able to resolve … Continue reading →

Alexandre Kojève’s seminars on Hegel’s Phenomenology of Spirit, given at the École Pratique des Hautes Études in the years before the Second World War, are an important and much discussed moment in European intellectual history. The lectures were edited and published … Continue reading →
